data.title: Veterans Day ceremonies planned throughout New Jersey
data.meta_description: Friday is Veterans Day. The holiday, originally called Armistice Day, was created to honor veterans of World War I. In 1954, Congress passed legislation setting Nov. 11 as a day to honor American veterans of all wars. Here are...
data.text:
Friday is Veterans Day. The holiday, originally called Armistice Day, was created to honor veterans of World War I. In 1954, Congress passed legislation setting Nov. 11 as a day to honor American veterans of all wars. Here are some of the observances planned:

BLOOMFIELD

Veterans Day observance participants will assemble at Bloomfield Town Hall Friday at 10 a.m. and march to the Veterans memorial on Broad Street for a ceremony. (973) 338-4256.

EAST ORANGE

A wreath-laying ceremony and program will be held Friday at 11 a.m. at city hall, 44 City Hall Plaza, with light refreshments served in the rotunda beginning at 9 a.m. (973) 414-4141.

LIVINGSTON

Veterans of all ages who are Livingston residents are invited to lunch and a performance by the AARP Livingstones singing group, sponsored by the Livingston SYLS Department, Friday from 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. at the Livingston Senior and Community Center, 204 Hillside Ave. Registration required. livingstonsyls.org or (973) 535-7925.

Patriotic services honoring veterans will take place Sunday at 11 a.m. at Temple Beth Shalom, 193 E. Mt. Pleasant Ave. murriet@verizon.net or (973) 992-3130.

MAPLEWOOD

Ceremonies will be held Friday at 11 a.m. at town hall, 574 Valley St. twp.maplewood.nj.us or (973) 762-8120.

MILLBURN

Ceremonies will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at Legion Post 140, 200 Main St. Guests are invited to remain afterward for hot dogs and refreshments. (973) 379-9866.

MONTCLAIR

There will be a Veterans Day observance Friday at 11 a.m. at Edgemont Memorial Park on Valley Road, with the playing of Taps and a performance by the Montclair Community Band. (973) 509-4915.

NEWARK

The third annual Veterans Day Gala will take place Friday from 6 to 9 p.m. at the Newark Club, 1 Newark Center. Honorees will include Army Specialist Jeans Cruz, Fox News host Geraldo Rivera, PSEG CEO Ralph Izzo and Newark Mayor Cory Booker. gigofund.org or (973) 242-0658.

NUTLEY

Ceremonies Friday at 11 a.m. at the WWII Veterans Memorial on Vincent Place will include a performance by the Nutley High School Chamber singers and a formal flag disposal ceremony. (973) 284-4976.

VERONA

Ceremonies will be conducted Friday at 11 a.m. by the mayor and council on the steps of town hall, 600 Bloomfield Ave. veronanj.org or (973) 857-4848.

WEST ORANGE

Ceremonies will be held Friday at 11 a.m. in front of town hall, 66 Main St. westorange.org or (973) 325-4050.

CLARK

Services will be held Friday at 11 a.m. at the entrance to Arthur L. Johnson Regional High School, 365 Westfield Ave. alj.clarkschools.org or (732) 382-0910.

ELIZABETH

Ceremonies will take place in Winfield Scott Park Friday at 11 a.m. (908) 820-4124. elizabethnj.org or (908) 351-6257.

FANWOOD

A ceremony sponsored by American Legion Post 209 and VFW Post 10122 will be conducted Friday at noon at Fanwood Memorial Library, North Avenue and Tillotson Road. fanwoodlibrary.org or (908) 322-9845.

KENILWORTH

As part of the Veterans Day ceremonies, Memorial Park will be rededicated as Robert E. Jeans Sr. Veterans Memorial Park Friday at 11 a.m. Refreshments will be served following the ceremonies. kenilworthveterans.com or (908) 272-9483.

MOUNTAINSIDE

Veterans Brick Dedication, There will be a Veterans Brick Dedication Friday at 2 p.m. at the Deacon Andrew Hetfield House, Constitution Plaza. mountainsidehistory.org or (908) 232-8608.

NEW PROVIDENCE

A Veterans Day observance at the American Legion Post on Elkwood Avenue Friday at 11 a.m. will be followed by a luncheon for senior citizens with food donated by local restaurants and musical entertainment. Reservations required. (908) 665-0045.

PLAINFIELD

Ceremonies will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at City Hall, 515 Watchung Ave. plainfield.com or (908) 753-3000.

RAHWAY

Members of local veterans groups and civic organizations will participate in ceremonies Friday at 10:30 a.m. at Veterans Memorial Park, Rahway, West Grand and St. Georges avenues. The program will include music by the Rahway High School Marching Band. (732) 381-8028,

ROSELLE PARK

Veterans Day services will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at Veterans Memorial Library, 1404 Chestnut St. roselleparklibrary.org or (908) 245-2456.

SCOTCH PLAINS

A ceremony sponsored by American Legion Post 209 and VFW Post 10122, will be held Friday at 11 a.m. at the Veterans Monument, Park Avenue and Front Street. (908) 322-9845.

SUMMIT

A convocation sponsored by American Legion Lindsey-Street Post No. 322 will be held Friday at 2 p.m. at Lawton C. Johnson Summit Middle School. (908) 273-1190.

The “From Oath to Home: An Evening to Honor Our Troops” Bonds of Courage gala will take place Friday at 6:30 p.m. at the Grand Summit Hotel, 570 Springfield Ave. The evening will include keynote speaker Maj. Gen. K. Rieth, dinner, door prizes, silent and live auctions and entertainment by the USO Liberty Belles. $175. bondsofcourage.org or (908) 273-4122.

WESTFIELD

Veterans will meet Friday at the United Methodist Church parking lot on Ferris Place and march to the World War I memorial for ceremonies starting at 11 a.m. American Legion Post No. 3 at 1003 North Avenue West will serve refreshments following the ceremonies. (908) 247-7630.

JEFFERSON

A small parade will begin Saturday at 10:15 a.m. at the Middle School and end at the Veterans Memorial in the municipal complex for ceremonies, followed by refreshments in the municipal building, 1033 Weldon Road in Lake Hopatcong. jeffersontownship.net or (973) 697-1500.

MADISON

First responders and military veterans will be honored at ceremonies hosted by American Legion Post 43 Friday at 11 a.m. at the World War I Monument, Park and Madison avenues. gov.rosenet.org.

MORRIS PLAINS

VFW Post 3401 will host memorial services Friday at 11 a.m. at the post on Tabor Road. vfwwebcom.org/nj/postdirectory or (973) 702-0405.

MORRISTOWN

A re-creation of how the Foster and Woods families observed Thanksgiving in the early 20th century will include a special observance of Armistice Day, noon-4 p.m. Sunday, Fosterfields Living Historical Farm, 73 Kahdena Road. $6, $5 seniors, $4 ages 4-16, $2 ages 2-3, free ages 1 and younger. morrisparks.net or (973) 326-7645.

RANDOLPH

The United Way of Northern New Jersey and Morris County Chamber of Commerce’s Leadership Morris will sponsor a March for Military Families fundraiser, noon to 3 p.m. on Sunday at the County College of Morris, 214 Center Grove Road. unitedwaynnj.org or (973) 579-3040.

ROCKAWAY

A veterans day commemoration hosted by American Legion Post 344 will feature guest speaker Col. Scott Armstrong from the Picatinny Arsenal, light snacks and refreshments, 7:30 p.m. Friday, at the Post, 210 onChestnut Terrace. (973) 627-9717.

EAST BRUNSWICK

The Veterans Day observance Friday at 6 p.m. will include a wreath-laying, bagpiper, Boy Scout chorus, patriotic sing-along and refreshments. Veterans Park, East Brunswick Municipal Complex, 1 Jean Walling Civic Center. (732) 390-6797.

EDISON

Ceremonies will be held at various locations Friday from 8 a.m. to noon, including the Menlo Park Soldiers’ Home, the Bonhamtown Monument and Veterans Park. (732) 548-4648.

MONROE

Wreath-laying services will be held Friday at 8:30 a.m. at the Triangle Memorial, 9:15 a.m. at town hall and at 10 a.m. at Veterans Park on Avenue K. monroetwp.com or (732) 521-4400.

PERTH AMBOY

Ceremonies will take place at the war memorial on Sadowski Parkway Friday starting at 11 a.m. (732) 826-0290.

PISCATAWAY

John F. Kennedy Library, 500 Hoes Lane, will host a Veterans Day program Saturday at 1 p.m., with stories, photos and memorabilia from local veterans. piscatawaylibrary.org or (732) 463-1633.

PLAINSBORO

A wreath-laying ceremony will be held Friday at 10 a.m. at the municipal monument, 641 Plainsboro Road. plainsboronj.com or (609) 799-0863.

SAYREVILLE

Ceremonies will begin Friday at 10 a.m. at VFW Post 4699 on Jernee Mill Road and American Legion Post 211 on MacArthur Avenue. A march to borough hall will begin at 10:30 a.m., with ceremonies to follow there. The VFW post will serve refreshments following the ceremony. sayreville.com or (732) 390-7092.

HILLSBOROUGH

Ceremonies will take place Friday at 7 p.m. at the Garden of Honor, with a reception to follow in the municipal building, 379 South Branch Road. hillsborough-nj.org or (908) 369-4313.

MONTGOMERY

A Veterans Memorial will be dedicated Friday at noon in Montgomery Park on Harlingen Road, with a performance by the Montgomery High School band. A dinner will be held from 6 to 9 p.m. at the Princeton Elks Lodge in Blawenburg. (908) 392-3193.

NORTH PLAINFIELD

Ceremonies at Veterans Memorial Park at the corner of Willow and Myrtle avenues, will take place Friday at 11 a.m., hosted by the North Plainfield American Legion Ball-Kirch Post 265. (908) 754-7636.

ROCKY HILL

Ceremonies will take place in Panicaro Park, Crescent Avenue and Washington Street, starting at 1 p.m. Sunday, rockyhill-nj.gov or (609) 924-7445.

WATCHUNG

Ceremonies will be held at the memorial in front of the Texier House on Watchung Circle, Friday at 9:30 a.m. (908) 756-0080.

DELAWARE TWP.

The Sergeantsville VFW Memorial Post 8390 will conduct a patriotic ceremony Saturday from 10:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. at the municipal building, 570 Rosemont-Ringoes Road in Sergeantsville. (609) 397-3240.

LAMBERTVILLE

Veterans will conduct a short ceremony Friday at 11 a.m. at Lambertville City Offices, 18 York St. lambertvillenj.org or (609) 397-0110.

ALLENDALE

VFW Post 10181 will host ceremonies at Memorial Park Friday at 11 a.m. allendale.org or (201) 818-4400.

PHILLIPSBURG

A Veterans Day Tribute will take place Sunday at 1 p.m. at Phillipsburg High School 200 Hillcrest Blvd. Eight area veterans who left school to join the military will receive their high school diplomas. The Phillipsburg High School choir and band will perform and a live feed is scheduled with a Phillipsburg graduate serving with the U.S. Army at Fort Hood, Texas. pburg.k12.nj.us/PHS or (908) 213-2440.

HOPATCONG

Ceremonies will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at Veterans Memorial Park on Flora Avenue. hopatcong.org or (973) 770-1200.

SPARTA

Services will be held Friday at 11 a.m. in front of the Sparta VFW Hall, 66 Main St. vfwwebcom.org/nj/postdirectory.

BELMAR

Services will take place Friday at 9:30 a.m. at Monument Row on Main Street between 12th and 13th avenues, followed by services at 10 a.m. at the Doughboy Statue at Railroad Avenue between Seventh and Eighth avenues. (732) 681-0895.

HAZLET

Services and a wreath presentation will take place Friday at 10 a.m. at the James J. Cullen Center, 1776 Union Ave., followed by a similar program at Shorelands Cemetery and services at the VFW Hall on Davern Avenue. hazlettwp.org or (732) 739-0653.

HOLMDEL

A Veterans Day ceremony with keynote speaker Maj. Gen. Clark Martin and the induction of four New Jersey veterans into the “In Memory” program will be conducted Friday at 11 a.m. at the New Jersey Vietnam Veterans Memorial Foundation, 1 Memorial Lane. njvvmf.org or (732) 335-0033.

LONG BRANCH

A ceremony will be held Friday at 10 a.m. at Jerry Morgan Park on Liberty Street between Broadway and Joline Avenue, with essay contest winners and speakers at borough hall at 11 a.m. An open house at VFW Post 2140 will follow. (732) 571-6542.

The fourth annual Veterans Day Run and daylong celebration will embark Friday at 8:30 a.m. from Harley Davidson/Buell, 671 Broadway, with an escorted ride to New Jersey Vietnam Veterans Memorial in Holmdel, co-sponsored by Rolling Thunder NJ Chapter 2 to benefit Veterans Children’s Scholarship Fund. tompage@hdlongbranch.com or (732) 229-8518.

MARLBORO

There will be a salute to veterans with live entertainment and refreshments Friday from 2 to 4 p.m. at Sunrise of Marlboro, 3A S. Main St. sunriseseniorliving.com or (732) 409-6665.

MIDDLETOWN

A Veterans Day breakfast with eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon, coffee, juice and fresh fruit will be served Friday at 9 a.m. at Regal Pointe Senior Living, 1800 Route 35. Registration required. $5; free for veterans. regalmiddletown.com or (732) 957-0083.

MILLSTONE TWP.

Ceremonies will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at the Veterans Memorial next to the municipal building, 470 Stage Coach Road. . Refreshments will be served in the community center following the ceremony, millstone.nj.us or (732) 446-4249.

OCEANPORT

Ceremonies will begin Friday at 11 a.m. at borough hall, 222 Monmouth Blvd. (732) 229-2626.

SPRING LAKE

American Legion Post 432 will conduct a ceremony Friday at 11 a.m. at Veterans Memorial Park, Passaic and Warren Avenues. springlakeboro.org or (732) 449-8005.

BEACH HAVEN

Ceremonies will be held Friday at 10:30 a.m. at Veterans Bicentennial Park at Engleside and Beach avenues. (732) 506-9090.

MANCHESTER

A ceremony will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at town hall, 1 Colonial Drive. All veterans in attendance will be presented with a commemorative pin. (732) 657-8121, ext. 3310.

TOMS RIVER

A parade will begin Friday at 9:30 a.m. at the Toms River Shopping Center, Route 37 and Main Street, and travel south on Main Street and east onto Washington Street. Following the parade, ceremonies will be held at town hall on Washington Street. (732) 341-1000.

PRINCETON

Activities will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at the Veterans Monument at the corner of Nassau and Mercer streets. princetontwp.org or (609) 924-5704.

WEST WINDSOR

A ceremony will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at the Dutch Neck World War II Monument, followed by ceremonies at noon at the municipal building, 271 Clarksville Road. westwindsornj.org or (609) 799-2400, ext. 213.

BERGENFIELD

Ceremonies will begin Friday at 11 a.m. at borough hall, followed by rededication of the monument at Veterans Memorial Park on New Bridge Road. bergenfieldboro.com or (201) 387-4055.

CARLSTADT

Services will be conducted at Memorial Park Friday at 11 a.m. (201) 939-2850.

CLIFFSIDE PARK

A service with Father Willie Smith and Rabbi Engelmayer of Temple Israel will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at Trinity Episcopal Church, 555 Palisade Ave., followed by refreshments. (201) 941-0643.

DEMAREST

An outdoor ceremony at the Northern Valley Regional High School flag pole will begin Friday at 11:15 a.m., followed by a 1 p.m. assembly at Tenakill Middle School. The American Legion will hold a ceremony Friday at 11 a.m. at Veterans Memorial Park. (201) 768-5386.

EDGEWATER

The traditional ceremony will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at Memorial Park, Route 5 and River Road. 943-1700, ext. 3131.

FAIR LAWN

Ceremonies at the municipal building, 8-01 Fair Lawn Ave., will be hosted by the Fair Lawn Veterans Council Friday at 11 a.m. fairlawn.org or (201) 794-5340.

GARFIELD

The fourth annual Veterans Day Gala will be held Friday from 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. at Royal Manor, 454 Midland Ave., with a four-course luncheon, happy hour, dancing to live band, show, boutique shopping and door prizes, Registration required. $50-$55. aceshows.com or (800) 831-9801.

HACKENSACK

A brief ceremony honoring veterans will be followed by refreshments Friday at 11 a.m. at the Courthouse Green, Main and Court streets. hackensack.org or (201) 646-3980.

LEONIA

American Legion Post No. 1, 399 Broad Ave., will host ceremonies Friday beginning at 11 a.m. (201) 592-1332.

LITTLE FERRY

Ceremonies will be conducted in front of Memorial and Washington schools on Liberty Street Friday at 11 a.m.. Afterward, food and refreshments will be served at the VFW at 100 Main St. (201) 641-6186.

MAHWAH

Mahwah’s ceremonies will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at Veterans Memorial Park on Franklin Turnpike. mahwahtwp.org or (201) 529-5757.

NEW MILFORD

The annual ceremony will taker place Friday at 11 a.m. at the Veteran’s monument in front of borough hall, 930 River Road. newmilfordboro.com or (201) 967-5044.

NORTHVALE

Northvale VFW Memorial Post 162 will conduct a ceremony Friday at 11 a.m. in front of the municipal building, 116 Paris Ave., with refreshments following at the American Legion Hall on Paris Avenue. boroughofnorthvale.com or (201) 767-3330.

OAKLAND

Annual ceremonies will be held Friday at 11 a.m. at Veterans Park, 1 Veterans Drive. oakland-nj.org or (201) 337-8111.

PARK RIDGE

The Wyckoff Midland Park VFW Post 7086 will hold ceremonies Friday at 11 a.m. at Midland Park Veterans Park. co.bergen.nj.us/parks or (201) 336-7267.

RIDGEFIELD PARK

A traditional service will be held Friday at 11 a.m. at the Ridgefield Park Flagpole, Euclid Avenue and Mt. Vernon Street. ridgefieldpark.org or (201) 641-2612.

RIDGEWOOD

Ceremonies will take place Friday at 11 a.m. at Graydon Park and include a rededication ceremony for a plaque being installed to honor the memory of the 14 Ridgewood casualties from World War I. (201) 670-5510.

RUTHERFORD

A ceremony hosted by Rutherford Veterans Alliance will start Friday at 11 a.m. at the WWI monument on Park Avenue near the Rutherford Post Office and travel from monument to monument with different participants giving speeches about each war. rutherford-nj.com or (201) 939-9895.

TEANECK

The Patriotic Observance Advisory Board will conduct ceremonies Friday at 11 a.m. on the Municipal Green. teanecknj.gov or (201) 488-6800.

BLOOMINGDALE

Services honoring veterans will take place at Sloan Park Friday starting at 11 a.m. (973) 492-3212.

CLIFTON

A ceremony with New Jersey National Guard veterans of Afghanistan as special guests and entertainment by Amp’d will take place Friday at 9 p.m. at Clifton Commons Mall, Route 3 East. cliftoncommons.net.

HALEDON

A memorial service and wreath-laying ceremony will take place Friday at 6:30 p.m. at the Veterans Memorial Monument and community band shell, with refreshments afterward in the recreation center. haledonboronj.com or (973) 942-6538.

HAWTHORNE

Friday’s activities will begin at 11 a.m. and include the dedication at 12:30 p.m. of a portion of Tuxedo Avenue (at Grand Avenue) to two residents killed in the Korean War. hawthornenj.org or (973) 427-5555.

PROSPECT PARK

Honorably discharged veterans and Prospect Park senior citizens are invited to a Veterans Day-Thanksgiving dinner Friday at 4 p.m. at the municipal building, 106 Brown Ave. Call (973) 790-7902, ext. 516, for reservations.

WANAQUE

Members of Wanaque’s veterans posts, the American Legion and VFW will conduct services Friday at 11 a.m. at the soldiers monument at borough hall, 579 Ringwood Ave. wanaqueborough.com or (973) 839-3000.

KEARNY

Ceremonies Friday at 11 a.m. at Veterans Park will be sponsored by American Legion Post 99 and feature the playing of Taps, a police color guard and an elementary school fife and drum corps. kearnynj.org or (201) 955-7400.

UNION CITY

Union City will hold a wreath-laying ceremony Friday at 9:30 a.m. in Ellsworth Park, New York Avenue and 23rd Street. (201) 348-5746.
